member.name: T:Neon.Xunit.Temporal.TemporalFixture
member.summary: Used to run Temporal server and its related database and services as a Docker compose application on the current machine as a test fixture while tests are being performed and then deletes the application when the fixture is disposed.

remarks.para: This fixture assumes that Temporal is not currently running on the local workstation or is running as as a application named temporal-dev. You may see port conflict errors if either of these conditions are not true.
See for more information about how this works.
remarks.note: You can persist instances to the underlying dictionary to make these clients available across all test methods. ensures that any of these clients will be disposed when the fixture is disposed, reset, or restarted.

member.name: M:Neon.Xunit.Temporal.TemporalFixture.Start(Neon.Temporal.TemporalSettings,System.String,System.String,System.String,Neon.Diagnostics.LogLevel,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Starts a Temporal compose application if it's not already running. You'll generally want to call this in your test class constructor instead of .
summary.note: You'll need to call instead when this fixture is being added to a .

member.param: Optionally specifies the Docker compose application name (defaults to temporal-dev).

param.name: composeFile
param.para: Optionally specifies the Temporal Docker compose file text. This defaults to which configures Temporal server to start with a new Cassandra database instance listening on port 9042 as well as the Temporal web UI running on port 8088. Temporal server is listening on its standard gRPC port 7233.
You may specify your own Docker compose text file to customize this by configuring a different backend database, etc.

member.param: Optionally specifies the default namespace for the fixture's client. This defaults to test-namespace.
Specifies the Temporal log level. This defaults to .
Optionally specifies that a new Temporal connection should be established for each unit test case. By default, the same connection will be reused which will save about a second per test case.
Optionally indicates that the application should remain running after the fixture is disposed. This is handy for using the Temporal web UI for port mortems after tests have completed.
Optionally disables establishing a client connection when true is passed. The and properties will be set to null in this case.
Optionally prevents the fixture from calling to put the Temporal client library into its initial state before the fixture starts as well as when the fixture itself is reset.
member.returns: if the fixture wasn't previously started and this method call started it or if the fixture was already running.

remarks.note: Some of the properties will be ignored including . This will be replaced by the local endpoint for the Temporal application. Also, the fixture will connect to the default Temporal namespace by default (unless another is specified).

A fresh Temporal client will be established every time this fixture is started, regardless of whether the fixture has already been started. This ensures that each unit test will start with a client in the default state.
